intro: Pteracanthus reflexus, commonly known as the reflexed pteracanthus, is a lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a plant of conservation interest.
